scenarioDescription:
The HD 5278 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 5278 is a star with 1.13 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.19 times its radius. It is located 187.82 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 5278 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 5278 system


HD 5278 b

HD 5278 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-04, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 5278 b is 7.804 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 5278 b is 2.450 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 5278 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 5278 c

HD 5278 c was discovered by the Paranal Observatory observatory, in 2021-04, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.24 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 5278 c is 18.409 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 5278 c is 4.490 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 5278 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 5278, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: HD 5278 - System With 2 Exoplanets
